page.title: 02Jackfield Village
page.content: Jackfield is a small village in the Severn Valley.It is one mile North East of Broseley and one mile North West of Coalport.It was built in this situation because of the clay.One hundred years ago Jackfield was{the {biggest tile manufacturer}in the world. Jackfield is almost surrounded by { {woodland,}in the north is a steep wooded escarpment known locally as the Cliffs,the woods are called Lloyds Coppice,in the east Preens Head Coppice,in the west Ladywood Coppice and in the south Monewood There are many visitors who come to see the museum of tiles at Craven Dunhill and Maws Craft Centre,or to walk or picnic by the river or in the woods. The focal points of the village are St Mary's Church,the Jackfield Brass Band & the Britsh Legion.
